content.description: Reach up or jump and pull onto two small crimps pretty high up, make a move to a crimp up left and throw to the top.  Getting established on the two crimps is the most difficult part.  Fun, short problem.
content.location: Located on the arete to the left of the downclimb, and to the right of Block Party

content.description:
Start on the slightly incut rail about 3 feet off the ground. Move to the gaston crimp on the left and put a scrunched heel hook on the start hold. Move to the slopey pinch on the arete, rock on the heel and pop up to the big jug in the seam. Top it out directly above that.

I am not seeing this route on mountain project or in a guidebook, so if any of the info is wrong, please let me know.
content.protection: Pads, one covering the rock that is very near the start.
content.location: About 6 feet left of Brown Power, and on the same face as Block Pock. Look for the rock right next to it.

content.description:
Great easier problem with the crux being the top-out being very slopey.

Start under Brown Power on the obvious horn and climb the big crack left to big holds on the face. Move up to the top on a big rail to a tricky top-out.
content.protection: Top-out needs a good sized pad. Spotter on the rock is good too.

content.description:
Start sitting with good edges just left of the blunt arete. Move the right up to a good angled crimp/edge, and then figure out a way to establish yourself on the good, high foot ledge. Finish as for the stand start.

Though adding a few tricky moves into the stand start, it is unlikely that this warrants the v10 grade that is is given in the guidebooks.
content.protection: A couple of pads are useful
content.location: This problem is located just right of the dihedral/corner on the side that faces away from the road (often used as the downclimb). Locate the obvious blunt arete and the start holds at its base.

content.description:
Start with your left hand on the arete and your right hand on a small crimp.  Throw up a high left foot and slap the block and stand up to better holds and top out.

A sit start adds a few grades and a star in my opinion.
content.location: Located to the right of the downclimb and to the left of Block Pock

content.description: Starts just right of  Brown Power on a big jug on the arete that is under the roof, then moves right through the roof and up the arete. Powerful and techy. Sick problem
content.location: On the Black Top boulder, about 300 yards away from the main boulders.

content.description:
Start sitting on the left side of the dihedral on some small crimps. Figure out a way to move left and up, eventually joining the finish of 'Whodunnit?' (v8).

It's a very long move to join that line.
content.location: Located on the back side of the boulder (away from the road), start sitting on the left side of the obvious dihedral (often used as the downclimb).

content.description:
Start matched on crimp rail, then move up and right to move crimps rails until you top out. Really fun little problem.

I believe this is the V0 Descent mentioned in the Kelley guidebook.
content.location: Back corner of Block Top boulder

content.description: Start both hands on the horizontal seam about head height and crank straight up over the roof.
content.location: This is on the obvious west facing overhang.Porcupine Rim Trail, Moab, UT 84532

content.description: Northeast Arete Start with left hand on left side in a two or three finger slot depending on your finger size and right hand on obvious hold on the right stand up to a slightly angled sloper move the feet and stand up to the top or dyno. should be easier for taller people.
content.location: Northeast arete on block top boulder

content.description:
Start on two opposing side pulls about 4 feet high. Move left to a good pocket and then up and left to the jug pocket. Easy top out.

Not sure I got the start right, but this seemed like the most obvious start for the line. Can definitely be started further right on "Squashed Arete" which adds about a grade.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the road facing side of the Block Top boulder

content.description: Start at the good low corner jug reach for pocket with your right and another obvious hold with your left and continue up crimpers
